detaileddescription.para: Instantiates a SpConfig object from a user config file. The caller of this constructor owns a reference. sp_config_unref() must be called when this object is no longer needed.

parameterdescription.para: the filename of the config file to read to fill the instantiated SpConfig

detaileddescription.para: Instantiates a SpConfig object from a user provided buffer. The caller of this constructor owns a reference. sp_config_unref() must be called when this object is no longer needed.

parameterdescription.para: the buffer from which the spconfig will be retrieved. We expect the buffer to be null-terminated.

detaileddescription.para: Instantiates a SpConfig object from a user config file and a factory config file. The caller of this constructor owns a reference. sp_config_unref() must be called when this object is no longer needed.

config_filename
the filename of the user config file to read to fill the instantiated SpConfig
factory_config_filename
the filename of the factory config file to read to fill the instantiated SpConfig
sp_config_new The user config file is read first to fill the SpConfig and then the factory config file is read. Therefore the configuration parameters defined in the user config file will be overwritten by the parameters defined in the factory config file.
Reads a user config file and fill the SpConfig with the read config values.

parameterdescription.para: The SpConfig object to fill with the content of the file
The filename of the config file to read to fill the SpConfig

detaileddescription.para: increment reference count
Decrement reference count, which will eventually free the object.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SpConfig *spconfig, const char *section, const char *key, const char *default_value)
memberdef.name: sp_config_get_section_param_string

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a section parameter item as a string, given its section and key.
The default value string is returned if the config item isn't found.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SpConfig *spconfig, const char *section, const char *key, const char *default_string)
memberdef.name: sp_config_get_string

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a configuration item as a string, given its section, key, and default value.
The default value string is returned if the config item isn't found.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SpConfig *spconfig, const char *section, const char *key, int *min, int *max, int default_min, int default_max)
memberdef.name: sp_config_get_range

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a configuration item as a range, given its section, key, and default min and max values.

simplesect.para: TRUE if the value is successfully parsed as a range, FALSE otherwise. If FALSE is returned, min and max are filled respectively with default_min and default_max values.

memberdef.argsstring: (const SpConfig *spconfig, const char *section, const char *key, int default_value)
memberdef.name: sp_config_get_int

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a configuration item as an integer, given its section, key, and default value.
The default integer value is returned if the config item isn't found.

The default integer value is returned if the config item isn't found.

detaileddescription.para: Retrieves a configuration item as a float, given its section, key, and default value.

briefdescription.para: Write a string in a file placed relatively with the Sephone configuration file.

Name of the file where to write data. The name is relative to the place of the config file
